intro: Pterichis galeata var. quilinsayacoana, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
